title: GIT version control system
description: Get more familiar with one of the most necessary developer's tool.

published_attributes.title: Course scope
published_attributes.serialized_body:
Probably it can be assumed that you are already familiar with GIT. What is more, probably you are also using it in your everyday work. However, you surely won't regret finishing this course.

In this course you will learn:

  • How GIT works under the hood
  • How to work with branches
  • How to create and use aliases
  • Difference between merge and rebase
  • How to undo code changes in different ways using GIT commands (revert vs reset)
  • And many other useful tips :)

Course Structure

This course consists of 7 short video lessons and 4 quiz questions aimed at consolidating the previously covered knowledge. No score is required to pass the test.

This course is based on a presentation prepared and ran by Michał Maćkowiak.

How to create and use aliases
Difference between merge and rebase
How to undo code changes in different ways using GIT commands (revert vs reset)
And many other useful tips :)

published_attributes.title: Table of Contents
published_attributes.serialized_body:
1. Centralized vs distributed version control system
  2. Head, branches, commits
  3. Aliases
  4. Merge vs rebase
  5. Reverting and reseting changes
  6. Collaborating on the repository
  7. Cherry-pick, reflog
  8. Resources and materials

published_attributes.title: Reverting and reseting changes
published_attributes.serialized_body: Did you mess up? No problem. You can always bring your code to the previous state. And again, there is more than one way to do that.

published_attributes.title: Resources and materials
published_attributes.serialized_body:
• An interactive, visual GIT training
  • 'Pro GIT' book
  • GIT good practices on Netguru Wiki
  • Recovering lost changes with git-fsck

If you have any valuable resources that could be added here, please provide them in the comments.
